🔎 Did you know that there are over 400,000 species of plants on our planet? However, we tend to eat just 200 different plant species, even though the number of edible plants for human consumption is a thousand times higher.
🌱 For
[#InternationalPlantAppreciationDay](https://www.linkedin.com/signup/cold-join?session_redirect=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.linkedin.com%2Ffeed%2Fhashtag%2Finternationalplantappreciationday&trk=public_post_reshare-text), we are reminded of our responsibility to ensure the regeneration of landscapes within our agricultural systems, and to preserve plants and seed diversity. 🌱
At the heart of biodynamic farming is the coexistence of humans and nature, the respect and care of plants, seen as a gift from nature to humanity. Whether it is to grow healthy produce or to preserve biodiversity, we believe in appreciating the gift of both wild and cultivated species.
That is why Demeter farmers dedicate 10% of farmland to the protection of biodiversity areas. They pledge to protect herbs, flowers, berries, nuts, grains, native plants, pollinator hedgerows and more, all contributing to plant diversity. To do so, they establish hedges, field margins, wildflower strips, orchards and pastures on their farmland.
Only by preserving our biodiversity through a thoughtful collaboration with nature will we prevent further loss of plant diversity, an essential solution against climate change. 🌿
